reviewText: Jeff Hardy has stunned the WWE Universe with amazing highlights in the ring and controversial moments out of it. Now fans can explore both sides fo this unconventional Superstar. Jeff Hardy: My Life, My Rules contains a revealing documentary packed with never-before-seen interviews from Jeff and both his closest confidants and biggest rivals. Recorded on the eve of beginning a new chapter in his life, Jeff discusses his tumultuous existence in 2008 and 2009, including his astounding rise to both the WWE and World Heavyweight Championships and his challenging personal struggles. Through the 27 matches on this 3-DVD set, fans can retrace Jeff's remarkable career, including a rare match from 1994, his tag team partnership with brother Matt, and battles for the Intercontinental, World Heavyweight and WWE Championships.Phoenix, AZ - August 25, 2009Jeff ReturnsAugust 25, 2009 - 9:59 PMJeff and Matt Reunite - The Hardys!August 25, 2009 - 10:03 PMOpportunity KnocksAugust 25, 2009 - 10:07 PMDark DaysRoad to RedemptionAugust 25, 2009 - 10:12 PMSacrifice is RewardedAugust 25, 2009 - 10:15 PMBrother vs. BrotherLiving for the MomentAugust 25, 2009 - 10:18 PMJeff's Omega?Special Features* Jeff's Faves* Motocross* Third Gear, Wide Open* Jeff's Art Gallery* Remembering Jack* The Original Hardy Boy* Will O' The Wisp* Behind the Paint: Jeff Prepares for SummerSlam* Gas Chamber Ink* The Hardy ShowMatchesJeff Hardy vs. 1-2-3 KidSuperstars - June 25, 1994Triangle Ladder Match for the World Tag Team ChampionshipThe Hardy Boys vs. The Dudley Boyz vs Edge & ChristianWrestleMania 2000 - April 2, 2000(Alternate Commentary with Jeff and Matt Hardy)Steel Cage Match for the World Tag Team ChampionshipThe Hardy Boys vs. Edge & ChristianUnforgiven - September 24, 2000Hardcore Championship MatchJeff Hardy vs. Mike AwesomeSmackDown! - July 12, 2001Ladder Match for the Hardcore ChampionshipJeff Hardy vs. Rob Van DamSummerSlam - August 19, 2001Jeff Hardy vs. Matt HardyVengeance - December 9, 2001Jeff Hardy & Shawn Michaels vs. Chris Jericho & ChristianRaw - February 17, 2003DISC 2Jeff Hardy vs. EdgeRaw - August 21, 2006Intercontinental Championship MatchJeff Hardy vs. Johnny NitroRaw - October 2, 2006World Tag Team Championship MatchThe Hardys vs. Lance Cade & Trevor MurdochBacklash - April 29, 2007#1 Contender's 4-Way Elimination Match for the Intercontinental ChampionshipJeff Hardy vs. Shelton Benjamin vs. Santino Marella vs. William RegalRaw - July 16, 2007Intercontinental Championship MatchJeff Hardy vs. Shelton BenjaminRaw - September 17, 2007Ladder Match for the Intercontinental ChampionshipJeff Hardy vs. CarlitoRaw - December 10, 2007Winner Receives a WWE Championship Match at Royal RumbleJeff Hardy vs. Triple HArmageddon - December 16, 2007Intercontinental Championship MatchJeff Hardy vs. Randy OrtonRaw - January 14, 2008WWE Championship MatchJeff Hardy vs. Randy OrtonRoyal Rumble - January 27, 2008Jeff Hardy vs. Shawn MichaelsRaw - February 11, 2008DISC 3Falls Count Anywhere MatchJeff Hardy vs. UmagaOne Night Stand: Extreme Rules - June 1, 2008#1 Contender's Match for the WWE ChampionshipJeff Hardy vs. John CenaRaw - June 2, 2009Jeff Hardy vs. John MorrisonSmackDown! - July 4, 2009WWE Championship MatchJeff Hardy vs. Triple HNo Mercy - October 5, 2008Extreme Rules MatchJeff Hardy vs. UndertakerSmackDown - November 14, 2008Triple Threat Match for the WWE ChampionshipJeff Hardy vs. Triple H vs. EdgeArmageddon - December 14, 2008Extreme Rules MatchJeff Hardy vs. Dolph ZigglerRaw - March 23, 2009Stretcher MatchJeff Hardy vs. Matt HardySmackDown - April 10, 2009World Heavyweight Championship MatchJeff Hardy vs. CM PunkNight of Champions - July 26, 2009Steel Cage Match for the World Heavyweight ChampionshipJeff Hardy vs. CM PunkSmackDown - August 28, 2009

reviewText: WWE hit a home-run with this DVD. Any wrestling fan will enjoy this dvd and Jeff Hardy fans will absolutely love this dvd. The documentary is a perfect balance of want-to-know information and entertainment. Jeff gets personal with his inner demons, has a few laughs talking about growing up, getting started in the biz, backstage shenanigans, and then gets serious about his career. It's a fantastic documentary.The match listing and extras are fantastic as well. WWE packed a lot of matches on this DVD set. The viewer is treated to solid RAW and Smackdown matches and to exceptional PPV matches. Hardy's best match with Orton is on this dvd, which is actually one of my favorite Hardy matches because of the ending. The ending, to me anyway, was totally unexpected making for a great match. There are a lot of other good matches on this set.If you're a Jeff Hardy fan or even a casual wrestling fan you'll like this DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: good dvd. i highly recomend this to your collection. this dvd has some crappy matches, but still a great dvd with a great documentary.disc 1jeff hardy vs. 123 kid-superstars june,25 1994this match just is a waste of time on this dvd. i don't even want to review this match.match rating:-2/5the hardy boyz vs. e&c; vs. the dudely boyz-triangle ladder match for the world tag team championships(wrestlemania 2000 april 2,2000)wow. what a classic for a match at wrestlemania 2000. amazing moments like the crossbody/legdrop, the swonton from the top of the ladder, and all the awesome table moments. it sucks that edge and christian won, but im happy that this match was put on here.match rating:5/5the hardy boyz vs. e&c-steel; cage for the world tag team championship(unforgiven 2000(september 24, 2000)great match here. another classic on this dvd made by the hardyz. pretty cool that this match actually had weapons like a chair and a ladder. some exciting stuff like lita doing a hurricarana off a ladder to christian, jeff hardy doing a witw off the top of the cage, a ca-chair-to from the top rope, and the hardyz winning the titles.match rating:4.5/5jeff hardy vs. mike awesome-hardcore match for the hardcore championship(smackdown july 12,2001)ok match here. not real crazy about it. i didn't really get why this match was put on here. a couple of weapons used like trash cans and lids, a ladder, kendo stick, and a broom. almost a watchable match.match rating:3/5jeff hardy vs. rvd-ladder match for the hardcore championship(summerslam 2001 august 19, 2001)wow. another great match by jeff. not as good as the triangle and cage match but is still really good. a lot of moonsaults by suprisingly both men, and a ton of ladder use. really exciting and definatly a good match to say oh my god in some moments.match rating:4/5jeff hardy vs. matt hardy-vengence 2001 december 9,2001i kind of thought matt hardy had the advantage when lita was named special ref. other than that, she called the match fairly and a good match with jeff getting the win with a swanton that had total impact.match rating:3.5/5jeff hardy and shawn michaels vs. chris jericho and christian-no dq(RAW febuary 17,2003)good match here. i like that this match had a stipulation to it. hardy got dominated most of the match because michaels was hancuffed. funny moment when jericho got sweet chin musiced when michaels was hancuffed. sadly the only weapon that was used was a chair. but good match with hardy getting the win for his tag team.match rating:3.75/5disc 2jeff hardy vs. edge-RAW august 21,2006this match wasn't even 8 minuets. i would have expected more out of these two and a longer match.match rating:2.75/5jeff hardy vs. johnny nitro-intercontinental championship(RAW october 2,2006)pretty good. as i expected, there was a lot of highflying action out of both men. this match is really almost a waste of time because i perfer their ladder and cage match on this dvd.match rating:3.5/5The hardyz vs. lance cade and trevor murdoch-world tag team championships(backlash 2007 april 29,2007)good match here. this dvd should have also had their judgement day match too. some good team work by both teams. i was happy that the hardys won and came out champs.match rating:4/5jeff hardy vs. shelton benjamin vs. santino marella vs. william regal-fatal four way elimination match for the #1 contendership(RAW july 16,2007)this match shouldn't have been on here. this match freakin stinks. this doesn't even deserve to have been a match.match rating:2/5jeff hardy vs. shelton benjamin-intercontinental championship(RAW september 17,2007)decent match here. is a little worth watching. i really don't think this match was suppose to be on here in my opinion. some good moments with hardy winning.match rating:2.5/5jeff hardy vs. carlito-ladder match for the intercontinental championship(RAW december 10,2007)pretty highflying and brutal match here.the brutal moments when carlito gets dropkicked and cracks a ladder, the sunset flip off the top of a ladder, and the backstabber on a ladder. highflying and just plain out brutal match.match rating:3.5/5jeff hardy vs. triple h-winner gets a wwe championship shaot at the royal rumble(armageddon 2007 december 16,2007)good match here. what made this match kind of boring is that jeff was dominated and refused to fight triple h almost all of the match. but jeff finally gets a wwe title shot when he won at the end of the match with a rollup. this match is where the dvd finally picks up again.match rating:4/5jeff hardy vs. randy orton-intercontinental championship(RAW january 14, 2008)this match is a piece of s***, because it didn't even last 15 seconds. the only way this match is getting a good rating is because i hate ortons guts, and the swanton is the best i have ever seen.match, sorry, swanton rating:5/5jeff hardy vs. randy orton-wwe championship(royal rumble 2008 january 27,2008)another good match in this set. this match went outside most of the match. hardy using some highflying stuff with a what i call the "rail walk", and the amazing moonsault from the dangerous top rope. i was pissed when i saw orton get the rko out of nowhere.match rating:4/5shawn michaels vs. jeff hardy-RAW febuary 11,2008good match put on by these two. this match was a chop fest for hbk, and a good match for hardy. i was surprised that hardy wasn't really his highflying, risktaking self in this match.match rating:3.5/5and last but not least, the best dvd of all,disc 3umaga(r.i.p) vs. jeff hardy-falls count anywhere(one night stand 2008:extreme rules june 1,2008)wow. this match is freakin priceless. this match has everything from ground and pound, to super highflying. highflying moments like the sairwell rail slide clothesline, the fall umaga took off the truck, and the amazing swanton. great match here and a great opener for hardy getting the win.match rating:4.25/5jeff hardy vs. john cena-winner gets a wwe title shot a night of champions(RAW june 2,2008)pretty good match here. terrible ending when that fan got into the match causing cena to win by d.q and face triple h at night of champions.match rating:3.5/5jeff hardy vs. john morrison(smackdown july 4,2008)good, fast paced match. this, in my opinion is not better than their 2006 and early 2007 encounters for the intercontinental title. this match is watchable, but not really worth being on here.match rating:3/5jeff hardy vs. triple h-wwe championship(no mercy 2008 october 5,2008)wow. what a show by two wwe greats. this match has everything you could want in a match. from ground and pound from triple h, to the highflying skills of jeff hardy. this match in my opinion should have been runner up for match of the year. but for the triple h and jeff hardy counters, this is definatly the best one of all.match rating:5/5jeff hardy vs. undertaker-extreme rules(smackdown november 14,2008)another great match on this dvd. this has only three weapons, but has great action. a lot of chair use and a out-of-nowhere moment by jeff hardy with the kendostick. this match went back and forth for about 17 minuets. i loved every minuet of this match. very exciting match, and definatly worth watching. also, if you have seen jeff hardy vs. undertaker, ladder match from RAW 2002, then this match will bring back some memories when hardy pulls out a ladder.match rating:4.5/5jeff hardy vs. triple h vs. edge-triple threat match for the wwe championship(armageddon 2008 december 14,2008)wow. a third classic on this dvd. this match has everything you want in a triple threat match. this match(as usual)has spears, whisper in the winds, and twist of fates. this match also involves a chair and a anounce table. great moment at the end with hardy getting a double swanton on triple h and edge after a pedigree to win his first world title.match rating:4.75/5jeff hardy vs. dolph ziggler-extreme rules(raw march 23,2009)this match is also another one of my waste-of-time matches. i have no idea why this was put on here. they should have put jeff vs. matt extreme rules.match rating:1.75/5jeff hardy vs. matt hardy-stretcher match(smackdown april 10, 2009)really good match. worth watching, but not my favorite hardy vs. hardy encounter. cool moment when jeff took a ride on the stretcher and did a midair clothesline. i wasn't happy that matt won, but, was really cool how he won(jeff missing a swanton and landing with impact on the stretcher).match rating:3.5/5jeff hardy vs. cm punk-world heavyweight championship(night of champions 2009 july 26, 2009)good match. this is my third favorite punk/hardy encounter, next to the tlc match and steel cage match. good action for a fast paced match. cheap that Punk tried to retain and take a easy way out by getting counted out to retain, but hardy caught him and finally won the world title back. this match was a great starter for the hardy/punk buildup.match rating:4/5Jeff hardy vs. cm punk-retirement steel cage match for the world heavyweight championship(smackdown august 28,2009)great match for punk and hardy. this is definatly one of the best smackdown matches ever. great moments with a swanton bomb, hardy getting suplexed off the cage, and punk escaping. sad ending with hardy saying goodbye to the fans and everybody crying. but this is definatly a match worth watching.match rating:4.5/5this dvd could have had a lot of matches that could have made it better, but, still a entertaining dvd. i recomend this to your wwe collection.
summary: The rise and fall of Jeff Hardy
Title: N/A

reviewText: There is one alias that summerises Jeff Hardy perfectly in that he's a "charismatic enigma."  He will go down as one of the most unique competitors in WWE history as Jeff just has a different "IT" factor than other wrestlers do to connect with the audience.  Throughout the documentry, you'll hear from not only Jeff but other various talents like his brother Matt, Shannon Moore, Gregory Helms, John Morrison, Triple H, C.M. Punk, and Michael Hayes.  Also keep in mind that this DVD set came out between the period where Jeff Hardy had left WWE but didn't debut in TNA yet.This documentry was setup differently than any previous one we've seen before as WWE knew that this was going to be Jeff's last obligation with WWE for a period of time so throughout the presentation, you'll go through a timeline of Jeff's last night in WWE from getting ready backstage to the actual cage match to his farewell speech to the fans.  Jeff's return is talked about first with the reasons behind his first departure & the story behind behind his comeback, going into his first feud with Johnny Nitro (the current John Morrison), and reuniting with Matt to reform their tag team.  One imporant element of the documentry is talked about next with Matt Hardy talking about the difference between teaming with his brother both times before going into Jeff's reasoning behind his first wellness policy violation.  The importance of his Armaggedon match against Triple H was discussed next before going into his match against Randy Orton at the Royal Rumble including the memorable swanton off of the RAW stage.  His second wellness policy was heavily discussed next with both him, Matt, and others talking about how Jeff let the company down followed by Jeff having another tradegy with his house being burned to the ground.  Earning back the trust of the WWE is discussed next before going into his feud with Triple H that elevated him into the main event status & eventually had him gain the WWE Championship.  The feud against his brother Matt was heavily discussed next including details of the pyro malfunction incident back in January & their trilogy of matches.  His Extreme Rules match with Edge was highlighted before going into the feud with C.M. Punk with both men talking about the difference between their "straight edge vs. free spirit" lifestyles, Punk cashing in his case, Hardy's win at Night Of Champions, their T.L.C. match, and the final encounter inside the steel cage. The documentry closes out talking about what's in his future (obiviously TNA wasn't mentioned) clocking in at a little under an hour.Matches Include:vs. 1-2-3 Kid - This was just a quick squash match showcasing Jeff's early days as "enchancement talent.""Superstars" June '94Ladder Match: Hardy Boyz vs. WWE Tag Team Champions Dudley Boyz vs. Edge & Christian - Eventhough these three teams are more famous with being the innovators of the T.L.C. match, this was actually the precursor to that match in this being the first triple threat ladder match.  This match topped the previous ladder match between the Hardys/Edge & Christian months earlier at No Mercy & was a non-stop highlight reel with tables getting involved along with so many memorable moments like Jeff Hardy's swanton off the biggest ladder in the match & Matt Hardy going through a table that look like it exploded on impact.The bonus commentary with Jeff & Matt include both talking about why they felt this was the golden era of tag teams, comparing the past looks of everyone in the past to the present, who named the "Wisper In The Wind", and also having some fun at Bubba Ray Dudley's expense.WrestleMania 2000[Edge: Decade Of Decadance]Steel Cage Match: Hardy Boys vs. WWE Tag Team Champions Edge & Christian - Jeff Hardy got knocked off the top of the cage to the outside floor early in the match leading to Christian & Edge seperating the Hardy's from each other & double teaming one while keeping the other for a majority of the match until the Hardy's were able to comeback & use the same gameplan to win the WWF Tag Team Titles. Various highlights include Matt being double suplexed off the top of the cage, Jeff using a ladder to knock Christian outside the cage along with doing a Wisper In The Wind off the top of the cage, Hardy's doing a con-chair-to to Edge on the top of the cage who then fell backwards off, and Lita doing a frankensteiner on Christian off the ladder.Unforgiven '00[Hardy Boys: Leap Of Faith]vs. WWE Hardcore Champion Mike Awesome - This was your typical hardcore match in WWE as it was both men using weapons such a trash can & a ladder while Hardy did his best impression of a witched witch with a broom but this was more about setting up Awesome match at the upcoming Invasion PPV with Edge & Christian getting involved."SmackDown!" July '01WWE Hardcore Championship/Ladder Match for vs. Rob Van Dam - This didn't top their match at Invasion or live up the standards that the Hardyz set in ladder matches but it was still something to watch. The only thing bad would be various blown spots as RVD tried to be innovative but the spots didn't go off as planned. Good but sloppy at times.SummerSlam '01vs. Matt Hardy - Lita was the special referee here as Matt & Jeff had problems for weeks with Matt being upset at Jeff's daredevil nature backfiring on the team so many times.  Both men worked a more grounded style that they were known for here with Matt getting fustrated at times with Lita refusing to show any bias towards him.  At one point Jeff was able to counter an attempted sunset flip off the apron onto a headsissors on the floor.  Jeff hurt his leg & Matt exploited it to the point where he was being very heelish causing Lita to keep getting involved.  The ending was a bit controversal but left the door open for this feud to continue...which for fans who don't remember, never did due to personal issues between both men & management at the time.Vengeance '01w/Shawn Michaels vs. Chris Jericho & Christian - For those who don't remember, weeks before this match had Jeff Hardy on a losing streak causing him to get very fustrated & begin to show heelish actions with Shawn trying to reach out to Jeff to get him back on the right track.  This was a tag match made last minute with the No Disqualification stipulation causing Shawn to wrestle in his normal shirt & jeans instead of his usual gear.  It started out with everyone brawling on the floor before Jericho & Christian were able to handcuff Shawn in the corner causing Hardy to fight both men alone.  Both men worked over Jeff while taunting HBK before Shawn was able to get himself uncuffed & deliever Sweet Chin Music to Jericho's face with a chair followed by a swanton to victory in what turned out to be Hardy's last big victory before leaving WWE a short time later."Raw" Feb. '03vs. Edge - Jeff returned to WWE & confronted Edge earlier that night leading up to this match.  It started off intense with Hardy doing a baseball slide & suicide dive onto Edge to the point where Edge ended up bleeding from the nose.  Hardy came close to getting the win in his first match back before Lita got involved causing John Cena to appear afterwards but if you can get past the ending, this was definately a good TV quality match & a great showcasing for Jeff's return."Raw" Aug. '06vs. WWE Intercontinental Champion Johnny Nitro - This was a match that was very competitive between both men with Nitro working over Jeff's back after missing the Wisper In The Wind at one point with moves like the baseball slide kick into the post & a different variation of the backbreaker.  Both men showcased their unique style of movesets of high flying & along with their different kicks with both men coming close in near falls before Nitro was backdropped off the top rope followed by the Swanton Bomb.  Another good quality TV match."Raw" Oct. '06World Tag Team Championship Match: The Hardys vs. Lance Cade & Trevor Murdoch - This was one of the best tag team matches of the year right behind the various matches in the Hardys/MNM series. The match had it all you would expect in a good tag team match: double team moves, suspension for a tag team partner to finally make a tag after getting beat on for minutes, mat wrestling & highspots. Good & solid match to kick off the show but the one moment to look out for is Trevor Murdock's executing TNA wrestler Petey Williams' "Canadian Destroyer".Backlash '07Elimination Match vs. Shelton Benjamin vs. Santino Marella vs. William Regal - This was to determine the #1 challenger for the Intercontinental Title against Umaga at the Great American Bash.  Santino at this time wasn't his comedic character that we now know him for but still this was a good match overall that saw some storytelling that we're used to in these type of matches such as the "honor amongst theives" in Regal & Benjamin before it became every man for himself.  A nice match but nothing special."Raw" July '07WWE Intercontinental Championship Match vs. Shelton Benjamin - Hardy didn't come into this match 100% as he was still feeling the effects of his match with Great Khali the previous week.  This was another nice match that was given time to be good & competitive but never seemed to leave "first gear" or had anything memorable about it once it was over."Raw" Sept. '07WWE Intercontinetal Championship/Ladder Match vs. Carlito - This was on RAW's 15th Anniversary Show & Carlito's first ladder match in WWE (not sure if he's had one in Puerto Rico or anywhere else).  Carlito hit Hardy with the ladder early before Jeff fought back & dropkicked Carlito off the apron onto the ladder lying on the rail.  For his first ladder match, Carlito took some nasty bumps like doing a sunset flip powerbomb on Hardy off the ladder & later being backdropped on the ladder while also working over Jeff's leg including wedging it inbetween the ladder.  This isn't one of those ladder matches that will stand the test of time but was still a good encounter."Raw" Dec. '07vs. Triple H - This was all about Triple H making Jeff Hardy step his game up as the beginning had Hardy hold back a punch before Triple H slapped him & yelled for Hardy to "FIGHT ME!" before Hardy returned the slap to Triple H. From here, they went back & forth with each other with Triple H getting more aggressive every time it looked like Hardy would make a comeback. Great match that served it's purpose in elevating Hardy to the main event.Armageddon '07[Hardy Boys: Twist Of Fate]WWE Intercontinental Championship Match vs. Randy Orton - Don't let the title fool you because Randy Orton had no intentions of winning the Intercontinental Championship here but everything that happened after the match is more memorable here as we saw the biggest swanton bomb Hardy has ever given in WWE."Raw" Jan. '08vs. WWE Champion Randy Orton - This match had a big match buildup & feel to it. They gave it their all here & showcased a performance that had the crowd going back & forth more than they had any other time of the night with Orton getting the victory after a RKO out of nowhere. Orton got the strong performance & CLEAN PPV victory he's been needing since becoming champion.Royal Rumble '08vs. Shawn Michaels - Both men here started off fast paced with the action going back & forth between both men with quick pin attempts.  Hardy worked over HBK's neck with aggressive headlock takeovers various times while Shawn was able to keep countering Jeff's offense like the back suplex into a crossbody along with delievering a powerslam off Jeff's walking the outside railing clothesline before working over Jeff's back with moves like the half crab submission & elbow drops.  This was a PPV quality encounter that we got as a RAW main event that did the job in showing Hardy could hang with one of the best."Raw" Feb. '08Falls Count Anywhere Match vs. Umaga - Just based off the on & off feud these two have been having for close to a year now and they're past performances in these type of matches, you got exactly what you would expect as it was Umaga's power vs. Jeff's speed. They went from the ring to the outside & through the crowd with chairs, the retaining wall, and plastic traffic cones being used in the process before finally making their way outside (including a cool spot where Hardy slid down the handrail on the steps onto Umaga) with Hardy getting the win after a swanton bomb off the top of a semi-trailer. Good opener & possibly their best match together.One Night Stand '08vs. John Cena - This is the first & only time these two met in a rare match here on RAW to see who would go on to face Triple H for the WWE Championship at Night Of Champions.  The match got off to a almost comedic start as a fan jumped into the ring early causing Cena to temporarily stop the match while you can clearly see both of them holding back their laughter.  What else can I say here as this was a very competitive match from start to finish with the crowd hot from start to finish that ended with Cena rolling through Hardy's crossbody into an F-U."Raw" June '08vs. John Morrison - This was Jeff Hardy's debut as a member of the SmackDown roster against his old rival here.  As we've seen in the past, both men have unique offense when it comes to their flying & ground game which we saw here including an instance where Hardy "crashed & burned" on the outside.  Morrison was able to avoid & counter Hardy's moves throughout the match such as ducking the Wisper In The Wind while also delievering a pele kick to Hardy on the top rope.  This doesn't surpass their previous encounters but was still a good quality match."SmackDown!" July '08vs. WWE Champion Triple H - I can try to summerize this match but Jim Ross said it best at the end, "one of the most competitve WWE Title matches I can remember calling." The counters, great wrestling, fast paced action, and crowd that was hot throughout the entire match made this be one of those matches that made both men come out looking strong than they did coming in no matter who won or lost.No Mercy '08Extreme Rules Match vs. Undertaker - Jeff Hardy was bugging Vickie Guerrero to get another shot at the WWE Championship while Vickie was also having her own problems with Undertaker at this time so she figured she would "kill two birds with one stone" here & put Hardy in an Extreme Rules match with Hardy earning the title shot if he wins.  Hardy returned to wearing his facepaint of old for this match as he used his speed to get an early advantage before Taker caught Hardy & worked over his back ramming it into the ringpost, using steel steps, and tossing him into the ringside barrier.  Various weapons were used such as a chair when Taker doing his apron legdrop onto Hardy along with both men using the kendo stick at one point.  Big Show did get involved here and gave an unintential assist to Hardy who then used both a chair & a ladder to gain his victory."SmackDown" Nov. '08vs. WWE Champion Edge vs. Triple H - For the second year in a row, Edge is in a main event triple threat for a championship while this is Triple H's 7th multiman main event in a year for those trivia fans. Some action moments throughout the match like Triple H & Jeff Hardy doing a classic "Hardy Boyz" spot onto Edge early in the match, Hardy's wisper in the wind with Triple H holding Edge in an "electric chair," the traditional announce table spot, and that finishing move by Jeff Hardy that you were just waiting all match for him to pull off. This was the match of the night here with this match doing exactly what the other matches were lacking in that it buildup with getting more intense & fast paced overtime with the perfect World Championship win celebration afterwards that was as perfect of a moment that any wrestler or fan can ask for.Armageddon '08Extreme Rules Match vs. Dolph Ziggler - This was pretty short & sweet as this was put here to showcase a more vicious side of Jeff leading into his match against Matt by using weapons to do more impactful moves like the Twist Of Fate onto the trash can & just beating Dolph with a chair."Raw" Mar. '09Stretcher Match vs. Matt Hardy - This started off with a bang as both men brawled to the outside with Matt using the stretcher early & suplexing Jeff on it before Jeff used the stretcher himself later on to surf it down the ramp to deliever a clothesline.  Matt brought his A game here as we saw him utilize a different version of the sleeper where he had Jeff carry all his weight on the front of his body instead of the back before trying to run Jeff over with the stretcher on the outside.  Jeff took some daredevil chances with the stretcher such as attempting a ledrop from the top rope onto it but overshooting his target causing it to catapult into Matt's face.  Later on, Jeff missed the swanton bomb onto the ladder resulting in Matt being able to knock him out with a chair for Matt to score another win."SmackDown' 'Apr. '09vs. World Champion C.M. Punk - This was similar to their match at the Bash as far as how both men worked well together but also different in that Punk was now in full heel mode which was shown various times such as him trying to take advantage of anyway he can retain his championship either by pinfall, submissions like the dragon sleeper, or even trying to rush the referee into doing a countout at one point but Hardy refused to lose. Everyone really came off their feet towards the end when Hardy went "crazy" once Punk tried to cheat Hardy out of the championship again like he did at The Bash leading to what J.R. liked to call "the Hardy Party."Night of Champions '09Steel Cage Match vs. World Champion C.M. Punk - The final encounter in their feud as the loser of this match would leave WWE.  Jeff Hardy was showing the effects of their T.L.C. match earlier in the week on the way to the ring before he was attacked from behind by Punk...who also had his shoulder taped up from their SummerSlam match.  Punk kept constantly trying to escape the cage every quick chance he had early on before Hardy was able to recover & make a comeback.  This went back & forth between both men struggling to escape at times such as Punk grabbing on to the steel steps to stop Hardy from pulling him back in, Hardy being "Spiderman" like in an attempt to climb over the top while later just dangling on the outside of the cage before being superplexed back in by Punk before just like SummerSlam, they were fighting at the top before Hardy fell & Punk left victorious."SmackDown" Aug. '09Hidden DVD extras include Jeff Hardy getting into a paint fight with Nitro & Melina, accepting his Slammy Award, and interrupting the Undertaker before their Extreme Rules match.  In the end, I liked the documentry as it covered everything that the previous one (Twist Of Fate).  The match selection isn't perfect as I would have preferred that some of the irrelevant matches that were just average at best (1-2-3 Kid, Mike Awesome, Elimination Match, Dolph Ziggler) been replaced with matches that were more relevant or better quality to Hardy's career (tag matches with Matt vs. MNM from the ECW PPV, the ladder match vs. Benjamin & Hass come to mind off the top of my head, or the forgotten cage & ladder matches vs. Edge & Christian from RAW)  I have to say I'm overall satisfied with the match selection as we only had 3 DVD repeats but at least did something extra with one of them by adding Matt & Jeff's commentary to the WM2000 match with the other being the cage match which hasn't been released in a very long time so it comes off as a new fresh match.  In the end, I'm satified with this release & it's something I would recommend to fans of Jeff Hardy.
summary: The Good Times, Bad Times & Exit Of A Charismatic Enigma
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Charismatic Enigma, The Rainbow Haired Warrior and other terms can be used to describe Jeff Hardy, a man who has been a huge part of tag team wrestling and of course finally achieved his dream of winning the WWE championship on 3 occasions. He has battled through personal demons, heartache and loss and through it all has legions of fans who appreciate his effort, sacrifice and his willingness to take major league risks in the ring to entertain all his fans.Disc 1This is his story, which bounces back and forth between his final WWE match against CM Punk on Smackdown and him reflecting on his career, his departure in '03, his return in '06 along with his matches he had with John Morrison, reuniting with his brother Matt and winning the tag team titles with him, battling through his drug suspension and coming back to win the WWE title in shocking fashion. His rivalry in '09 with his brother and his second and three WWE titles are talked about along with Jeff saying he is gone but he will be back.The bio is good though short, there are some good moments especially when he talks about how a fire at his home in '08 during his drug suspension changed him and made him more driven to succeed when he came back. While I don't agree with how Jeff seemingly just doesn't get it (see his arrest for drug possession in September of '09, shortly after he left WWE for example), he has had many good matches and does seem to enjoy what he does in wrestling and in life.Special Features-Jeff's Faves: He talks about his favorite music, bands and other things.-Motocross: We see Jeff's love of Motorcross racing including him riding on his own track on his property.-Third Gear, Wide Open: Jeff's friends tell a story about how he did a couple of insane stunts on his homemade track.-Jeff's Art Gallery: We get treated to seeing some of Jeff's unique art, including some interesting paintings.-Remembering Jack: Emotional segment where Jeff reflects on how he lost his dog Jack in the house fire in '08.-The Original Hardy Boy: They introduce they're father who talks about Jeff and Matt when they were younger.-Will O' The Wisp: An early character that Jeff created when they were wrestling in Omega in their indie days.-Behind The Paint: Some behind the scenes footage of Jeff preparing his look for his match at Summerslam.-Gas Chamber Ink: It's Shannon Moore's tattoo shop, where Jeff praises it for being a unique setting to get work done. Also how Shannon came up with the name. Then Jeff talks about the meaning behind his tats.-The Hardy Show: The infamous internet show where Jeff, Matt and their friends are just being goofy beyond words.-6/25/94, Superstars, vs. 1-2-3 Kid: A quick one here of Jeff in his early days, Jeff hits a nice overhead arm drag early on, Kid ends up hitting some nice kicks, Hardy does end up going for the move later called Whisper In The Wind but he misses. Kid locks on a unique submission move and Hardy taps out. 3/10.-4/2/00, Wrestlemania 2000, Triangle Ladder Match for the WWE Tag Team Championship, wMatt Hardy vs. The Dudley Boyz (Champions) vs. Edge & Christian: The prelude to the TLC series of matches and quite a good one as all three teams get some good spots in. Christian hits a dive to the outside onto Matt and Bubba Ray, later Bubba hits a cutter on Christian off the ladder, the best spot was when Jeff Hardy hits a big swanton onto Bubba off of a ladder through a table. Matt is up trying to get the belts when Edge knocks him off and he falls through a table in the ring, Edge & Christian grab the titles to become the new champions. Great match, 9/10. Features alternate commentary by Jeff and Matt Hardy.-9/24/00, Steel Cage Match for the World Tag Team Championship, w/Matt Hardy vs. Edge & Christian (Champions): Great cage match here where early on E&C; knock Jeff out of the cage and they double team Matt slamming him into the cage and beating him down. Jeff tries everything to get back into the cage to help his brother and finally got to by using a ladder to scale up the cage then he hit a huge Whisper In The Wind off the top of the cage catching his brother on accident with it. The end was great as Christian was out of the cage, Matt and Jeff double teamed Edge and hit a big con-chair-to at the top knocking Edge into the ring, then Jeff and Matt drop down to win the titles. 9/10.-7/12/01, Smackdown, WWE Hardcore Championship Match, vs. Mike Awesome (Champion): During the horrifying WCW/ECW invasion angle we have this rare match featuring Awesome in the ring. Its pretty short, Mike does hit some power moves, there's some weapon use, Edge & Christian interfere allowing Jeff to hit the Swanton and covers to win the Hardcore title. 5/10.-8/19/01, Summerslam, Ladder Match for the WWE Hardcore Championship, vs. Rob Van Dam: Interesting one here as both men are high flying risk takers and they went all out here. There were a couple of botches involving the ladder, but both men made good use of the weapons namely the ladders. They both take and give some hard shots and also have some bad falls. It ends with RVD pushing Jeff off the ladder into the ropes then climbs to get the Hardcore title and win. 9/10.-12/9/01, Vengeance, vs. Matt Hardy, Special Guest Referee Lita: Matt was upset with his brother for taking too many risks and costing them the tag titles against the Dudleys at Survivor Series, so we have this match. Its not bad but it doesn't really feel right as I don't think fans bought into the Hardy's fighting each other, Matt tried to beat some sense into his brother and locked on a sleeper. Jeff of course took to the air, hitting a flying clothesline and a second rope leg drop, but he gets caught in the tree of woe which Lita breaks up. Matt locks on a single leg crab and later Jeff can't hit a splash cause of his injured leg. At the end Jeff hit the Swanton and covered Matt who got his foot on the rope but Lita didn't see it as she counted Matt down. 6/10.-2/17/03, Raw, No DQ Tag Team Match, w/Shawn Michaels vs. Chris Jericho & Christian: This isn't a bad one here, Jericho and Christian work over Michaels then handcuff him to the ring rope, then they beat up Hardy who makes the tag to Shawn after he uncuffs himself. Shawn and Jeff do a nice double team move sending Jeff onto Christian, Jericho gets Sweet Chin Music slamming a chair into his face then Hardy hits the Swanton and covers to win. 6/10.Disc 2-8/21/06, Raw, vs. Edge: Its Jeff's first WWE match in over 3 years and its against an old rival Edge, who was the WWE champion at this time. Its not bad, Jeff does come at Edge full of fire hitting a splash over the top to the outside and from there Edge gains the advantage for a few grounding the high flyer. Hardy comes back hitting the Whisper In The Wind, hits the Swanton soon after, covers but it gets broken up by Lita causing a DQ. 6/10, then John Cena comes down and chases Edge through the crowd.-10/2/06, Raw, WWE Intercontinental Championship Match, vs. Johnny Nitro (Champion): A good rivalry and exactly the type both men needed as Jeff helped establish Nitro as a true superstar. Jeff hit some quick moves to throw Nitro off his game, Johnny however grounded Hardy with a camel clutch and continues to focus on the back after Jeff misses a Whisper In The Wind. Jeff makes his comeback and the closing minutes feature some close nearfalls and ends with Hardy hitting the Swanton and covering to win the title. 8/10.-4/29/07, Backlash, World Tag Team Championship Match, w/Matt Hardy vs. Lance Cade & Trevor Murdoch: Good tag team match here where Cade & Murdoch said before they weren't gonna use any dirty tactics and while they did some good double team moves they kept their word. The Hardy's did quite well here also and its one of those forgotten tag team matches, the pace stays constant and the crowd is into it from the get-go. Matt ends up hitting the Twist of Fate, Jeff hits the Swanton and Matt covers to win. 7/10.-7/16/07, Raw, #1 Contender's 4-Way Elimination Match for the WWE Intercontinental Championship, vs. Shelton Benjamin w/Charlie Hass vs. William Regal vs. Santino Marella: Not a bad one here, given the different styles each guy gets a chance to shine. Its well paced but short, Regal hits a running knee on Marella covers and he's gone, Regal continues to have a good showing, however Jeff hits a Twist of Fate, covers and Regal's gone. Jeff and Shelton have a good but short match of their own, Benjamin looks like he has it won, but Jeff hits a small package and gets the 3. 7/10.-9/17/07, Raw, WWE Intercontinental Championship Match, vs. Shelton Benjamin: After being attacked by The Great Khali the week before, the question was asked was Jeff 100%? Well Hardy displayed good mat wrestling and hit a nice slingshot splash to the outside, Shelton took over after a missed Whisper In The Wind and targeted the head and neck. It ends with Jeff countering a suplexplex then hits the Swanton and covers to win. 8/10.-12/10/07, Raw, Ladder Match for the WWE Intercontinental Championship, vs. Carlito: Forgotten ladder match here and not sure why as its not an all time classic but good for a TV match. Carlito did well in his first ladder match in WWE, he grounded Jeff and made good use of the hardware, however he does take a hard fall onto a ladder set up against a barricade. There are some good bumps to follow, like a sunset flip into a powerbomb off the ladder by Carlito, however there is a botch as Jeff totally misses a Swanton. At the end Hardy does push Carlito off the ladder and grabs the title to win. 8/10.-12/16/07, Armageddon, Winner Receives a WWE Championship Match at the Royal Rumble, vs. Triple H: Good main event here, it was all about whether Hardy could hang with let alone defeat Trips, and for a while even though he did well Trips kept beating him down but couldn't keep Jeff down for three. The pace stays at a good clip, there are some close nearfalls and the closing minutes are pure gold and shockingly Hardy reverses a Pedigree into a roll-up and pins Trips for 3. 8/10.-1/14/08, Raw, WWE Intercontinental Championship Match, vs. Randy Orton: Really this was just a backdrop for Orton to get his hands on and take out Hardy before their match at the Royal Rumble. It quickly ends as Randy hits a low blow causing a DQ, the aftermath had some good brawling but was more memorable with Jeff hitting the biggest swanton in his WWE career onto Orton. 7/10, for the aftermath.-1/27/08, Royal Rumble, WWE Championship Match, vs. Randy Orton (Champion): This was when they were starting to build Jeff up huge and he got his shot at the WWE title against the Legend Killer Randy Orton. Jeff was the Intercontinental Champion at the time so he had a chance to join an elite group by holding both titles. Their styles worked well together but despite Jeff's best attempts it was not to be as Randy countered a Twist of Fate into an RKO to retain his title. 8/10. This match served its purpose two-fold, it kept Randy's run as the heel champion going while continuing Jeff's push to main event status.-2/11/08, Raw, vs. Shawn Michaels: Two of the most energetic, risk taking wrestlers in history face off in this good one on one TV match. It starts with some good mat wrestling as they trade momentum, Jeff actually dominates for a few minutes before getting slammed into the floor mat by Michaels. Back in the ring Shawn targets the back with hammer blows, back breakers and even a sharp shooter but Hardy doesn't stay down or give up. Once Jeff finally comes back the pace really picks up, both hit some high impact moves but can't get the three count. Shawn goes for Sweet Chin Music, Jeff counters with the Twist of Fate, then the Swanton and covers to win. 9/10.Disc 3-6/1/08, One Night Stand: Extreme Rules, Falls Count Anywhere Match, vs. Umaga: Shortly after returning from a 60 day suspension Jeff was put into this match with the 350 lb. samoan and this match started off in the ring but quickly went into the backstage where Jeff skated down a stairway railing to clothesline Umaga. However Umaga kept up the offense beating down Hardy, it went out of the arena where Jeff ended up scaling a trailer and hitting a huge Swanton on Umaga and covered to win. 6/10. Side note: The ending was laughable as it was clearly obvious they kept a far away shot so the mat these two landed on could be removed before the count was made.-6/2/08, Raw, #1 Contender's Match for the WWE Championship, vs. John Cena: Not a bad one here as both have different styles but shockingly meshed decently well for this contest. There was early mat wrestling by both men with Jeff dominatinh, Cena starts hitting his usual moves, later Jeff missed the Swanton then we get Cena's 5 moves of doom goes for the FU which Hardy counters and starts hitting some big moves but only for two. Jeff goes for a crossbody, Cena catches him, rolls through and hits the FU and covers to win. 7/10.-7/4/08, Smackdown, vs. John Morrison: Its Jeff's return to Smackdown and he faces the same man he faced during his first few months back in '06 and its a good match though a tad short. Both know each other well and counter the others moves, Morrison tries grounding Hardy with wristlocks, but Jeff ends up hitting a crossbody off the ring apron. After Hardy crashes and burns on the outside, John targets the left arm but can't keep Jeff down for three. Hardy makes his comeback, hits a front suplex, then the Swanton and covers to win. 7/10.-10/5/08, No Mercy, WWE Championship Match, vs. Triple H (Champion): Great main event here where both just kept it going from bell to bell, Trips kept hammering the quicker Jeff, while Hardy hit his set of unique offense and even displayed some good wrestling to throw Trips off of his game (couldn't help myself there). The final minutes were especially good as both kept going for the kill but couldn't get the three, Jeff ended up hitting the Swanton covers Trips but gets rolled up for three so Triple H retains. 10/10.-11/14/08, Smackdown, Extreme Rules Match, vs. The Undertaker: After Jeff had cost Taker a victory against Koslov the week before and smashed both men with a chair we have this match. Its a good match though Taker tries wearing down the quicker man with clubbing blows and just beats him in and out of the ring for a few minutes. Jeff finally gets some shots in using a kendo stick, but Taker ends up getting ahold of it slamming it into Hardy's back. A ladder is brought in that Taker slams in Jeff in the corner, Big Show interferes chokeslams Taker, but ends up getting knocked out with a chair. Jeff ends up leaping over a ladder hitting a leg drop and covers Taker to win. 7/10.-12/14/08, Armageddon, Triple Threat Match for the WWE Championship, vs. Edge (Champion) vs. Triple H: This had a different feel then his previous match with Triple H at No Mercy as it felt like Jeff would still come up short of grabbing the brass ring. All three worked well together, there was the expected double teaming, Edge kept trying to steal the win when he could and the crowd kept ooing and aahing after each nearfall occured. Trips hits the pedigree on Edge and covers, but Jeff hits the Swanton and covers Edge to win his first WWE title. 9/10.-3/23/09, Raw, Extreme Rules Match, vs. Dolph Ziggler: Not a bad one here, though its not too extreme. Jeff uses a trash can to deliver a front suplex from the top, then a Twist of Fate, grabs a chair and slams Dolph with a chair a few times, hits another Twist of Fate, the Swanton and covers to win. 4/10.-4/10/09, Smackdown, Stretcher Match, vs. Matt Hardy: Its a good one here off the heels of their Extreme Rules Match at Wrestlemania 25. They both make good use of the stretcher, hit some high impact moves and take some hard hits. The best part is the end where Jeff goes for the Swanton but Matt dodges, Jeff lands on the stretcher, Matt pushes it across the yellow line and Matt is declared the winner. 7/10.-7/26/09, Night of Champions, World Heavyweight Championship Match, vs. CM Punk (Champion): After cashing in Money in the Bank at Extreme Rules on a beaten up Jeff, we have this rematch where it was all about whether Hardy would be able to channel is rage and recapture the title. Punk did great work ground Jeff, while Hardy had to take to the air to try to defeat the Straight Edge Champion. The match ends with Jeff hitting the Swanton and covers to win his second World Heavyweight title. 8/10.-8/28/09, Smackdown, World Heavyweight Championship Match: CM Punk (Champion) vs. Jeff Hardy: Besides the title this was also a Loser Leaves WWE Match, so Punk jumped Hardy during his entrance to gain the early advantage. Both men showed the effects of the TLC match they had 5 days earlier at Summerslam but still pulled off some high impact moves. There was a nasty superplex by Punk from the top of the cage. Hardy does almost win a few times, but in the end Punk kicks Hardy off the top of the cage and drops to the floor to retain the title and thus Jeff Hardy is gone from WWE. 9/10. Side note: Good thing too cause Hardy got busted for massive drug possession in his home a few weeks later.For Jeff Hardy fans this is a must, its packed with matches has some good special features and a good albeit short biography.

reviewText: Looks like some good stuff here...here are the matches you are gonna get...Disc 1Jeff Hardy vs. 1-2-3 KidSuperstars - June 25, 1994Triangle Ladder Match for the World Tag Team ChampionshipThe Hardy Boys vs. The Dudley Boyz vs Edge & ChristianWrestleMania 2000 - April 2, 2000(Alternate Commentary with Jeff and Matt Hardy)Steel Cage Match for the World Tag Team ChampionshipThe Hardy Boys vs. Edge & ChristianUnforgiven - September 24, 2000Hardcore Championship MatchJeff Hardy vs. Mike AwesomeSmackDown! reviewText: The price of this collection was far less than I thought I'd spend for this classic DVD set.  I am very satisfied with the prompt delivery.  My grandson thinks Jeff hardy is awesome and has enjoyed watching this DVD collector's set over and over.  I would recommend this vendor to a friend and will continue shopping with them in the future.

reviewText: Just finish watching the 3 disc dvd box set of jeff hardy my life my rules and I think that the box set was only worth 3 stars because in the documentary in disc 1, wwe more or less give a storyline documentary of jeff apart from 1 or 2 real life things that jeff likes and does.Disc 1 matches was good with 1 or 2 classic matches but I taught that they would have put some more attitude era matches with the hardys from 98 and 99 which was not there unfortunately.Discs 2 and 3 had some good matches ,some matches that he lost and some recent classic ones, however to me the lamest match to put on the dvd box set was matt vs jeff in a stretcher match ,they could have exclude that match and put the steel cage match where jeff did a huge wisperor of the wind leaping from on top of the cage and the last match was ok because I knew that jeff contract was up and I know that jeff was going to take a brake from the wwe and then come back to the wwe but he is currently signed with tna ,unfortunate, that he was caught for drug trafficking.Another thing I don't like was that they exempted his going away speech ,you know it was the end of the dvd so it would been cool for him to say goodbye at the end of disc 3.So all in all I would say this dvd set was good but could have been better ,so three stars.Jeff Hardy the charismatic enigma ,he will be back ,the question is when.
summary: It was good but could have been better.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Jeff Hardy is undoubtfully one of the most unique and interesting competitors to ever wrestle in the WWE, among other organizations as well. Now that he is away dealing with his personal life choices and problems, WWE decided to release a DVD set on this very charasmatic individual. If you're looking for a 2 hour documentary on this DVD as they have for Bret Hart, Ric Flair, or Shawn Michaels, well...do not look here as the documentary is around 10 minutes shy of an hour. Unlike the DVD "Twist Of Fate", nothing is discussed on Hardy prior to his return to WWE in 2006. From there, Hardy discusses various topics since his return to WWE in '06 such as his early rivarly with Johnny Nitro and wrestling Triple H, teaming up and feuding with his brother Matt, his "two strikes" with WWE since his return with the tragedy of his house being burned down, Jeff's number of title shots and eventually winning his first WWE Championship. Throughout the documentary however, it keeps going back and highlighting certain spots of his "last" match in the WWE against CM Punk. His brother Matt, Triple H, John Morrison, Shannon Moore, Gregory Helms, Jim Ross and among others join Jeff in discussing Jeff's career. Though I think WWE did a good job profiling Jeff's WWE career from '06 to now, the documentary surely could have been improved and more.SUPERSTARS (JUNE 25, 1994)VS. 1-2-3 KID - Essentially, this was just a dark match on Superstars for Jeff as he went against the Kid (a.k.a. Syxx, a.k.a. X-Pac). Nothing going on here but Jeff is able to score with his Whisper In The Wind if you're a fan of that move but if you want to see a really good Hardy and X-Pac match, I recommend their King Of The Ring '01 clash over the Light Heavyweight Championship. 1/5WRESTLEMANIA (APRIL 2, 2000)TRIANGLE LADDER WWE TAG TEAM CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH: THE HARDY BOYZ VS. THE DUDLEY BOYZ VS. EDGE & CHRISTIAN - This is the match that not only stole the show at WrestleMania but it showed that Jeff was without of a doubt, FEARLESS! To me, every ladder match involving the Hardys, Dudleys, and E&C; was unique in their own, idividual way. Like their later TLC Matches, this match is just breath taking. 5/5 [Alternate commentary with Jeff and Matt]UNFORGIVEN '00 (SEPTEMBER 24, 2000)STEEL CAGE WWE TAG TEAM CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH: THE HARDY BOYZ VS. EDGE & CHRISTIAN - Jeff is eliminated early in the match as he is the first man to escape the cage but that doesn't stop his involvement in the match. I felt this match morely showed the toughness and reselency of Matt's as he held his own against the tag champs for a good 10 minutes with Jeff not able to help. Jeff soon brings out a ladder where he scores with a Whisper In The Wind from the top of the cage with also Lita getting involved and scoring with a hurricanrana on Christian from the ladder. The ending involves Matt and Jeff hitting Edge with a con-chair-to on top of the cage allowing the Hardys to escape and win the Tag Team Titles. 4/5SMACKDOWN (JULY 12, 2001)HARDCORE CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH: VS. MIKE AWESOME - This match surely doesn't compare to Jeff's Hardcore Title Match with RVD a few short weeks later at Invasion but this match showed that Jeff can hangin there with one of the most powerful Hardcore champions ever in Mike Awesome. With help from his early rivals, Edge & Christian, Jeff wins the Hardcore Championship from Mike Awesome. 3/5SUMMERSLAM '01 (AUGUST 19, 2001)LADDER HARDCORE CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH: VS. ROB VAN DAM - Like I said about the Mike Awesome match, to me, this match doesn't compare to their Hardcore match a month earlier at Invasion. However, this is still a good ladder match between two of the best in this kind of environment. The ladder was used at perfect times when it needed to be used with both Hardy & Van Dam pulling off some good and unique moves with the ladders. Again, I have to say this match doesn' live up their match they had at Invasion but it was still good nevertheless. 4.5/5VENGEANCE '01 (DECEMBER 9, 2001)VS. MATT HARDY - This was a pretty solid match up right here with Matt's girlfriend at the time, Lita, being the special guest referee. Surprisingly, the Hardy brothers worked well against one another with some good ground work being used in the match. Matt did a good job focusing on Jeff's leg to take away the high flying offense Jeff is mostly known for. There were some pretty good counters and high risk along with a good mixture wrestling in the match. The match has a questionable ending but it worked in well and overall, this is a good match. 4/5RAW (FEBRUARY 17, 2003)NO DISQUALIFICATION MATCH: w/ SHAWN MICHAELS VS. CHRIS JERICHO & CHRISTIAN - Not a bad tag team match but the No DQ stipulation definitley did more good for the overall match product. Jeff went it alone for a while with his partner, HBK, being handcuffed to the bottom turnbuckle. But overall, nothing past RAW material as this match was just average at best. 3/5RAW (AUGUST 21, 2006)VS. EDGE - This was Jeff's first night back from his 3 year absence from WWE where he wrestled the current WWE Champion at the time. This match started out wildly with Jeff taking it to Edge from the gecko and from there, Jeff and Edge kept the match flowing at a steady pace with a number of near falls and counters until the botched ending involving Lita. Again, nothing past RAW material and if it wasn't for the botched ending, this match would have been better. 3/5RAW (OCTOBER 2, 2006)WWE INTERCONTINENTAL CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH: VS. JOHNNY NITRO - This match doesn't past the 10 minute mark but Jeff and Nitro kept the match exciting all the way through. I won't say this match surpasses their previous title match at Unforgiven or their later Ladder & Steel Cage matches for the I-C Title but nevertheless, this match served it's purpose crowning a new I-C Champion in Jeff. 3.5/5BACKLASH '07 (APRIL 29, 2007)WORLD TAG TEAM CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH: THE HARDY BOYZ VS. LANCE CADE & TREVOR MURDOCH - This match started off the night for Backlash and man, what a tremendous tag bout this is! I guess WWE was trying to revive their Tag Team division and the Hardys along with Cade and Murdoch certainly did that here in this match. This match had everything what a Tag Team match is suppose to have. Double teaming, moves done behind the referee's back, cheap shots, partner making the tag after being beat down for a long time and everything inbetween. Overall, this is a great match that did it's job. 4.75/5RAW (JULY 16, 2007)4-WAY ELIMINATION MATCH: VS. WILLIAM REGAL VS. SHELTON BENJAMIN VS. SANTINO MARELLA - This was a #1 Contender's Match to face Umaga for the I-C Title at The Great American Bash [That match available on "History Of The Intercontinental Championship"]. Once Santino was the first to go, the match went a steady pace that led to Regal and Benjamin double teaming Jeff for a brief period until Regal turns on Benjamin and is soon eliminated by Jeff. From there Jeff and Shelton wrestled for a little while until Jeff gains the victory after rolling up Benjamin for the win. 3.25/5RAW (SEPTEMBER 17, 2007)WWE INTERCONTINENTAL CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH: VS. SHELTON BENJAMIN - For RAW standards, this was a pretty enjoyable and competitive match up for the I-C Title. Shelton and Jeff displayed a great deal of competitive spirit as they both went out there and gave the RAW fans a good match. Yes, if this match was on PPV I would expect more but being on RAW, this match doesn't disappoint. 3.5/5RAW (DECEMBER 10, 2007)LADDER WWE INTERCONTINENTAL CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH: VS. CARLITO - Surely this isn't one of those Ladder matches will stand the test of time, but appreciation does have to be given to Jeff and Carlito as they both took some nasty falls off and on the ladder in this contest. And to my knwoledge, this is Carltio's first Ladder match and if that factoid is true, Carlito definitely took those bumps in this match like a man (LOL). Overall, this is a Ladder match this worth the time to view and is surely to deliver to anyone's standards. 3.5/5ARMAGEDDON '07 (DECEMBER 16, 2007)VS. TRIPLE H - To me, this is the most intensed HHH/Hardy encounter I have seen. A lot of variables in this match is what gave this match that intense factor such as the possibility of Jeff being slightly intimindated by "The Game" and HHH slapping Jeff directly in the face and screaming at Jeff "Fight Me!" before Jeff returning the favor. From there, HHH took it to Jeff with his power and pure dominance for the time being. It ends when HHH attempts the Pedigree and Jeff gets the slick roll up on HHH to gain the #1 contendership for the WWE Title. 4/5 [Match also available on "Twist Of Fate: The Matt And Jeff Story"]RAW (JANUARY 14, 2008)WWE INTERCONTINENTAL CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH: VS. RANDY ORTON - After the opening low blow from Orton, Orton gets himself DQ'ed. Then which, Hardy and Orton fights up to the staging area where Jeff scores with the Swanton Bomb of the top of the titantron. 0/5ROYAL RUMBLE '08 (JANUARY 27, 2008)WWE CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH: VS. RANDY ORTON - This match had a big time buildup and feel to it. Orton and Hardy gave a great performance out there and they produced a very good WWE Title Match. The MSG crowd was very electric in this match as Hardy and Orton went back and forth against one another. In the end, Randy Orton hits a RKO out of nowhere that vanishes the dreams of Jeff's becoming the new WWE Champion. 4.5/5RAW (FEBRUARY 11, 2008)VS. SHAWN MICHAELS - A week away from the Elimination Chamber, this is a great one-on-one match for Jeff as he went against someone many compared himself to. After powerslamming Jeff on the outside floor, Shawn made Jeff's back the focal point of the match. Overall, this is a great competitive match between two guys who are very similar in style and darn near in everything else. 4/5EXTREME RULES '08 (JUNE 1, 2008)FALLS COUNT ANYWHERE MATCH: VS. UMAGA - This match opened up ONS and was a pretty good opening contest but I did expect more from these two in this kind of environment. The match started out with some good action in the ring and soon flowed out into the crowd and around the enterance area. The match soon fell to the outside where the match ends after Jeff  Swanton Bombs Umaga off a 18 wheeler but you couldn't see where Jeff really landed which was a little cheap but still a good and enjoybale Falls Count Anywhere match. 3.5/5RAW (JUNE 2, 2008)VS. JOHN CENA - Surprisingly, Jeff has a good match with Cena here. Jeff was at his usual here as he entertained the fans with his high flying and unorthodoxed offense but Cena is one the who surprised me after I saw Cena pulling off a leap frog in this match! This match too was closely a very competitive match with the RAW fans in attendence getting behind both competitors. This is a solid match with some good counters and near pinfalls with a good amount mixture of wrestling and high risk. Good match that in the end, John Cena scores the win over Jeff after delivering the F-U. 3.75/5SMACKDOWN (JULY 4, 2008)VS. JOHN MORRISON - Again, I didn't feel this match was on the same level as their previous battles over the I-C Championship but either way, this was still one heck of a back and forth match presented by SmackDown. Jeff takes a nasty fall over the top rope straight down to the floor where from there, Morrison takes full advantage to wear down the broken body of Jeff's. Morrison does a fantastic job side stepping and countering certain Hardy maneuvers. For a SmackDown match, this match iss pretty solid and quite good. 3.5/5NO MERCY '08 (OCTOBER 5, 2008)WWE CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH: VS. TRIPLE H - Hardy and "The Game" definitely upgraded themselves in this match from what they did previously at Armageddon. Hardy and Triple H blended in pretty well with each other as they put on one heck of a competitive match up. This is a awesome WWE Title match and one of the bests I've seen from Jeff's career. 4.5/5SMACKDOWN (NOVEMBER 14, 2008)EXTREME RULES MATCH: VS. THE UNDERTAKER - Nothing extrodinary or past great here for this Extreme Rules match. A couple of good spots involving chairs, a kendo stick, and a ladder but no really variation at all besides Jeff going out there like he always do and "throwing caution to the wind". If you want to see a very good Undertaker/Hardy match, I recommend looking into their WWE Undisputed Title Ladder Match from RAW in '02. But as for this match, just the same ol' SmackDown stuff. 3/5ARMAGEDDON '08 (DECEMBER 14, 2008)TRIPLE THREAT WWE CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH: VS. EDGE VS. TRIPLE H - Now this match has an unbelievable championship main event feel to it. All the competitors brought their good stuff to the match. Great action in and out of the ring to include a sick table spot involving Edge delivering a spear to Jeff. I felt the end was a good finish where the interference was nearly un-noticable. This is a great WWE Title match & also, a true crowning moment for Jeff Hardy. 5/5RAW (MARCH 23, 2009)EXTREME RULES MATCH: VS. Dolph Ziggler - This is another poor match from RAW. A couple of hard shots from a steel chair and that's about it. 1.5/5SMACKDOWN (APRIL 10, 2009)STRETCHER MATCH: VS. MATT HARDY - 5 days removed from WrestleMania, the Hardy brothers find themselves in another barbaric match and from where I stand, I found this match to be very good. A few innovative spots dealing with the stretchers and the fact that both Matt and Jeff were willing to do anything to win made a good recipe. Just like how Matt won at WrestleMania, the same thing takes place here after Matt makes good after capitalizing on a mistake by Jeff. 3.75/5NIGHT OF CHAMPIONS '09 (JULY 26, 2009)WORLD HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH: VS. C.M. PUNK - Credit has to be given to C.M. Punk & to WWE for that matter in making Punk this super villain & a perfect opposition for Jeff Hardy in that sense. Punk worked the match entirely as a heel to allow Hardy to come back fighting strong & to allow the crowd to get all over Jeff Hardy's band wagon at the same time. Both Hardy & Punk fought hard and they delivered a good World Title Match. A very entertaining & good World Title match and a nice way for the "Hardy Party" to begin again. 4/5SMACKDOWN (AUGUST 28, 2009)STEEL CAGE WORLD HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH: VS. C.M. PUNK - Wow! To me, this was one of the greatest SmackDown main events ever and definitely the best main event from SmackDown in a long time. Hardy and Punk, literally gave all they could and they put on one great of a steel cage match for the World Championship. Punk first attacks Hardy from behind to gain advantage in the match but man from there, this match was a roller coaster ride. Just a great World Title match and in ways this match is my favorite Punk/Hardy encounter. 4.5/5I have mix feelings for this DVD. Where to me the documentary flat out wasn't that good at all, most of the matches chosen had no place belonging on this set. Yes, there are a few rare gems here but I found this DVD just a way to dramatize Jeff's current absence from WWE. What Jeff did outside of the wrestling ring was his own personal choice. Nobody made him do any of that stuff he did so the way I feel, he deserves this hardship and I do not feel sorry or guilt for Jeff one bit. Life is a world of choices, and Jeff (full knowing he already had 2 strikes) kept on making the wrong ones. But as a recommendation, unless you want to see a few of the good matches included here, I personally give this one a pass. If you want to see a very good documentary on Jeff (and on Matt for that matter) I recommend their previous DVD, "Twist Of Fate: The Matt And Jeff Story."
summary: Just A Wrestler Who Was Living For The Moment

reviewText: jeff has always been one of my all time favorite wrestlers so it was good to see what he had to say about his time when he left wwe and when he made his return before another departure
